xml.episodeInfo:
FUTURAMA
Episode 405
LEELA'S HOMEWORLD
Kristen Gore Dave, The Neutral Planet
xml.info: Opening Credits. Caption: It's Like "Hee-Haw" With Lasers.
Planet Express: Farnsworth's Lab. Bender, Amy, Hermes, Fry and Zoidberg are gathered around the table. Enter Farnsworth and Leela.
xml.speak: Good news, everyone! You all know the orphanarium where Leela grew up?
Sure. We talk about it all the time.
Really?
No. Burn!
xml.info: Fry and Bender high-five.
xml.speak: Well done, fellows! Anyway, said orphanarium has named Leela orphan of the year.
xml.info: Everyone cheers.
xml.speak: Yee-ha!
All right!
Your parents must be so proud. Oops! Sorry.
And the good news keeps on coming. Behold my latest invention.
xml.info: He presses a button on a remote and the wall opens up. A big machine with gauges and flashing lights slides forward.
xml.speak: Neat.
xml.info: Farnsworth pulls a switch on the machine and parts of it start to move around and make noises like the gum machine in Willy Wonka And The Chocolate Factory. A small green thing lands in a tray on the side of the machine.
xml.speak: Ta-da! It's a glow-in-the-dark nose you can wear over your regular non-glowing nose. Observe.
xml.info: He puts the nose on then presses a button on the remote and the lights go off. His new nose glows.
xml.speak: Whoa, clool!
Now I can punch you in the nose in the dark.
xml.info: Farnsworth sneezes and the nose flies off and lands on Bender's face. The lights come back on and everyone stares at Bender. He looks around.
xml.speak: (snuffed) Where'd it go?
xml.info: Amy goes behind the machine. It is spewing out green waste into barrels.
xml.speak: Hey, Professor what's all this scloop, glorking out of the machine?
That? It's uh...nothing. Yes, nothing. If you think it's anything you're a suspicous moron.
It looks like toxic waste. And it smells like toxic waste.
What does it taste like?
xml.info: Hermes tastes it.
xml.speak: Delicious fig pudding! Ooh, that's good! But a distinct aftertaste of toxic waste.
Alright, alright so the machine produces a few toxic by-products! You don't have to make a federal case out of it.
I'm afraid I do. I order you dispose of that toxic waste properly, or bribe me. Either way it'll cost $500.
500 real dollars? That's an outrage! Professor, I'll take care of that waste for $499 and 100 cents.
Hmm, I know that's a rip but I'll pay for the convenience. Do you take credit cards?
Let's find out.
xml.info: He swipes the card across his mouth.
Planet Express: Attic Balcony. Bender is holding a waste hose.
xml.speak: Alright, environment, you've met your match!
xml.info: He chuckles. He starts pushing the hose over the railings towards the street. On its way down the hose shoots some waste across the road where it hits and partially dissolves a tree. The tree falls onto a car which melts the road and disappears through a hole. The hose stops by a manhole and pumps waste into the sewers. Bender whistles and fans his money.
Cut to: Outside Planet Express. Vyolet the mutant crawls out of the sewer in a wedding dress. She splutters.
xml.speak: Hey, get back in the sewer, weirdy. No mutants on the surface.
But he ruined my wedding dress.
xml.info: Cut to: Planet Express: Attic Balcony.
xml.speak: Honey, that thing was ruined the minute it went on you. That's what I'm talkin' 'bout.
xml.info: He struts off with his cigar and money.

Cookieville Minimum-Security Orphanarium Auditorium. Party streams have been put up and there is a banner which reads "Wall Of Fame Induction. No Really Loud Snoring". Warden Vogel stands behind a lectern, addressing the rows of children and the Planet Express staff. Leela sits to his right in front of the wall of fame.
xml.speak: Y'know, it's not easy being an orphan, not if I have anything to do with it. But today's honouree, Turanga Leela, has really made something of herself . I'll never forget the night that cute little alien baby was abandoned on our doorstep. Because I have a photographic memory and I remember every night!
xml.info: Flashback - Cookieville Minimum-Security Orphanarium: Vogel's Office, 2974. Vogel is in his office and the doorbell goes. He opens the door, looks around, then looks down. baby Leela is in a basket. He picks her up and tickles her. Then he sees a note, written in the alien language.
xml.speak: What the...? An alien language? I guess you're an alien. What a beautiful gigantic eye you ha -- Well, come on in.
xml.info: Cut to: Cookieville Minimum-Security Orphanarium: Hallway. Vogel tosses the basket into an already high pile.
Flashback ends.
xml.speak: From those humble beginnings Leela went on to become a county-certified starship captain. And so it is my pleasure today, to nail her picture alongside those of our most distinguished alumini.
xml.info: The crowd cheers. Vogel starts to hammer a nail into the wall. Leela stands up.
xml.speak: Thank you very much. Like many of you I never knew my parents...
Give me a -- argh!
...I don't know if they were mighty alien overlords or simply underpaid alien janitors who fought crime on the side --
Picture's up.
(shouting) It's crooked!
xml.info: Vogel curses.
xml.speak: ...In the end though, it doesn't matter who my parents were. All that matters is what I learned here, within these unscalable walls, that I have strength to make it on my own, just like all of you kids here today.
xml.info: The kids in the audience cheer.
xml.speak: (chanting) Leela! Leela! Leela!
xml.info: Nina puts on an eye patch.
xml.speak: Look at me! I'm Leela!
Nuh uh, 'cause I'm double Leela!
xml.info: He covers both his eyes and runs into the wall. Leela's picture falls off.
xml.speak: That's it, Albert, no more espresso for you.
xml.info: Time Lapse. Leela is talking to Fry.
xml.speak: Mind if I get a picture of you with your picture for the news, ma'am?
Yes! I mean no! Just make sure you get my nonchalant side!
xml.info: One of the guys from the wall runs in behind Leela to get in on her photo.
xml.speak: Wooo!
xml.info: Planet Express: Corridor. Fry is walking when he hears Leela crying.
Cut to: Planet Express: Locker Room. Leela is sat crying. She takes her wrist thing off, there is a bracelet under it.
xml.speak: If those aren't tears of happiness, please stop crying.
(crying) It's OK, Fry, I'm fine. I won an award today.
Is it this room that's making you sad? It's probably the room. Come on, lets go for a walk.
xml.info: Outside Planet Express. Fry and Leela walk out of the building and walk down the street by the river. Leela has calmed down now.
xml.speak: I'm sorry you saw that, Fry. I usually try to keep my sadness pent up inside where it can fester quietly as a mental illness.
Yeah, I do that with my stupidness.
I told a whole crowd today that being an orphan made me strong. But all I really wanted was a mom and dad, to hold me and stroke my hair and tell me they loved me.
Then today's your lucky day because I happen to be a holding, stroking, lovin' machine! Also spankin'!
That's not even close to what I had in mind.
Well, anyway, just remember that people care about you.
I know. Sometimes when I'm lonely, I look up at the sky and I get this feeling that somewhere, on some unknown planet, circling a distant star, my parents are up there, looking down on me.
xml.info: From the sewers a pair of cyclopses look up at Leela.
Outside Planet Express. The next morning Bender backs up a truck to the manhole outside the Planet Express building. He hums to himself. Fry and Leela walk out of the building.
xml.speak: Yo yo, Bezender! What up?
My dumping business is booming. I just got hired to clean up the set of Free Willy 3.
xml.info: He presses a button and the truck tips out a whale. Bender forces it down the manhole by stamping on it.
xml.speak: Bender! Cut it out! First of all the sewer mutants will be mad. Second, everything else that's horribly wrong with what you're doing!
Ah, those stupid mutants can't do anything. You seem to be forgetting one simple fact, namely, I'm up here and they are safely down --
xml.info: Green sewage erupts from a fire hydrant and the manhole. Bender screams. The manhole grows bigger and bigger. Three mutants grab Fry, Leela and Bender and pull them undergroup. They scream. The hole carries on growing and takes Bender's dump truck with it.
New New York Sewer. Fry, Leela and Bender are tied up and suspended over a pool of green sewage.
xml.speak: (shouting) What did I do to deserve this?
Behold, our once beautiful mutigenic sewage lake.
The radioactive waste you dumped in it has made it brighten up to see how ugly we really are.
xml.info: She and Dwayne look at each other and cringe.
xml.speak: Oh, man!
As if our lives weren't miserable enough already!
Tell me about it!
Let the punishment commence!
Punishment?
No fair!
Bender's innocent!
The instant you touch these mutatious waters your DNA will be forever altered, turning you into horrible mutants like us. Especially him! Allow me to demonstrate!
xml.info: He pulls a lever and a rat is lowered into the sewage. It comes back up as a green pig with fins and bat wings. Leela and Bender groan and Fry wretches.
xml.speak: It's like that time I peeked in the kitchen at Imperial Hunan.
Submerge the prisoners.
xml.info: The crew are lowered towards the sewage. Bender starts to panic but suddenly comes to a realisation.
xml.speak: Wait. I don't even have DNA. Why am I screaming?
We're gonna beat you afterwards.
xml.info: Bender continues panicking.
xml.speak: (chanting) Mutate! Mutate! Mutate! ...
xml.info: Two hooded figures emerge from the crowd.
xml.speak: (shouting) Turanga Leela!
Who said that? How do you know my real name?
xml.info: The hooded figures climb onto the crane holding the crew over the sewage and turn it so they are no longer suspended over the lake.
xml.speak: Whee!
What are you doing? Stop it.
xml.info: Fry, Leela and Bender fall to the ground.
xml.speak: What happened?
I don't know. I think I saved us somehow.
(shouting) Go after them! The waters can't mutate us mutants!
xml.info: The mutants dive into the sewage and swim across. Fry, Leela and Bender run away.
Cut to: Mutant Town. Fry, Leela and Bender run down past the cafe's and Starbucks's.
xml.speak: They went this way!
xml.info: The crew stop outside an empty-looking building.
xml.speak: Quick! In there!
xml.info: He picks up Fry by his ankle and swings him at the window, breaking it. He and Leela jump in. Fry crawls in after them. The mutants run past unaware they are chasing no one.
xml.speak: Kill! Kill! Kill!
xml.info: Cut to: Building. The trio dust themselves off and look around. Leela sees a wall full of newspaper clippings and things to do with her.
xml.speak: Great chichi's ghost!
What's this junk?
It looks like...a timeline of my whole life.
xml.info: Fry sees a familiar newsclipping.
xml.speak: That's when we saved Earth from a giant asteroid of garbage.
And here's when I dropped out and bummed around India for a while.
And this is just last year at Space Mardi Gras.
Its like some kind of weird Leela museum...and I'm the Leela!
(whispering) Dude! Over here!
xml.info: Leela and Bender walk over to where Fry is, next to a shelf with lots of Leela stuff on it.
xml.speak: It's all the best stuff I ever flushed down the toilet! Those are some of my diary pages. And my screenplay!
And also - for some reason - the letter I wrote you full of my personal feelings.
Oh, I'm scared! My whole life has just been a show for some perverted mutant!
xml.info: The mutants approach the building.
xml.speak: They must be in here.
Yeah, after them.
And then Bender ran!
xml.info: He and Fry run for the door. Leela is still standing by the shelf.
xml.speak: Leela, freak out later. We're not done escaping yet!
xml.info: She doesn't move. Fry and Bender try to pull her away but she stays rooted to the ground. The mutants run in and grab them.
xml.speak: Got ya!
Take this!
xml.info: He kicks Fry in the shin.
xml.speak: Ow!
xml.info: Mutant Town.
xml.speak: This time I'm calling for the death penalty. And not just because I'm running for re-election as Supreme Mutant.
(chanting) Four more years! Four more years!
xml.info: The hooded figures emerge from the crowd again. One taps Raoul on the shoulder and whispers to him.
xml.speak: Oh, very well. Your attention. Instead of being tortured to death, the prisoners shall hereby be expelled from the sewers and never allowed to return.
(sarcastic) Oh cruel fate! Can we really never return to this dank pit of sewage?!
Wait a minute. Why aren't you gonna kill us anymore?
Yeah! What are you chicken? Buk buk buk bukuk!
(whispering) Shut up, you two! We can kill ourselves when we get home!
They'll need transportation to the surface. Bring in the airship.
xml.info: Some mutants haul in a pretty large patchwork balloon.
xml.speak: Eww!
We constructed it from the remnants of old discarded Macy's parade balloons: Underdog's groin, Bart Simpsons's left ear and right shin, Garfield's owner Jon's forehead.
Fire up the sewer gas!
xml.info: A Triclops Mutant turn the ballon gas on. Fry, Leela and Bender choke and gag. The balloon sails up and hits the roof of the sewers. The Triclops puts a plank out to a ladder.
xml.speak: Move it ya ugly normals!
xml.info: He forces Bender onto the plank. It wobbles. He looks down and gets dizzy.
xml.speak: Uh, I'm gettin' dizzy! I can't walk straight!
xml.info: He pulls a unicycle out of his chest cabinet and cycles along the plank. Fry and Leela climb on and quickly move across. Leela stops at the bottom of the ladder. The airship sails back down. Bender opens the manhole and he and Fry climb out. Leela, still on the ladder, looks back down.
xml.speak: Come on Leela. You can do it!
Hurry! We're missing our bus!
xml.info: Leela climbs the ladder but looks back down again at the mysterious hooded figures. She closes the manhole.
xml.speak: Whoa! What are you doing?
I'm gettin' on the bus!
(shouting) Don't worry! I'll be fine! (talking) They know something about me and I've got to find out what. The lake didn't mutate me. What is going on here?!
It worked for me. I used to be a little blonde girl named Virginia.
Eurgh! Who the hell are you?
No one. And watch your language young lady!
xml.info: They run off. She chases them. The Triclops gets in her way.
xml.speak: Stop right there! I don't want to hurt you. I didn't want you to hurt me either.
xml.info: Cookieville Orphanarium: Vogel's Office.
xml.speak: Leela's going nuts and I can't save her unless I learn more about her mysterious past. Isn't there anything else you can tell me?
Nah. Nothing that wouldn't be a waste of your time.
That's impossible because my time is worthless!
Huh. Well then there is one thing. It's the note I found with Leela the day she was abandoned. But it's written in Alienese, so no-one on Earth can translate it. Not even Brainzilla.
Hand it over.
Sure. I just wish I could be more helpful. Would you like some dirt on any other orphans?
Look, I'm trying to save someone here. I'll have to come back for those later.
xml.info: Planet Express: Farnsworth's Lab. Fry shows Farnsworth the paper.
xml.speak: Can you translate it?
Of course. But only into Beta Crypt 3, a language so complex, there's even less chance of understanding it.
I didn't ask for a completely reasonable excuse. I asked you to get busy.
Very well.
xml.info: He presses a button and the machine that makes glow-in-the-dark noses comes out of the wall again. Farnsworth feeds the paper in.
xml.speak: Isn't that the same machine that makes noses?

It can do other things. Why shouldn't it? Of course, even if it is possible to analyse the message there's no way of knowing how long it would take. It could take an hour or it could take a hundred million years.
xml.info: The machines dings.
xml.speak: Is it done?
Certainly not. Two dings means it's done. But not like that. Slightly more rapid.
xml.info: Two slightly more rapid dings. Fry gasps. Farnsworth shakes his head.
New New York Sewer. Leela chases the hooded figures through the tunnels but loses them where some pipes cross.
xml.speak: Where did they go?
xml.info: Some rubbish falls on her from above.
xml.speak: Good news, Leela. I landed the contract to empty all the spitoons in Little Italy.
xml.info: He empties a spitoon. Leela rolls out of the way of the spit.
xml.speak: Ew!
xml.info: Planet Express: Farnsworth's Lab. Fry is pacing up and down while Farnsworth is asleep. The machine rapidly dings twice. Farnsworth wakes up.
xml.speak: That's it, it's done! I can't believe it! My mind is boggling. The analysis of the note is printing out now.
xml.info: A dot matrix printer prints off the analysis. Fry tears it off and they both start to read it. Fry gasps.
Flashback: 20-Something Years Ago. 100-Something Feet Underground. A baby is born in the house Fry, Leela and Bender hid in in the sewers.
xml.speak: It's a girl.
xml.info: Two cyclopses look at their baby cyclops. The mother has tentacles and the ather's mouth is sideways.
xml.speak: My God! She's beautiful. No extra anythings.
xml.info: The father reaches his hand out. The baby grabs his finger and goos.
xml.speak: What people skills.
She's completely perfect!
In my professional opinion as an ear, ear, ear, nose and throat doctor, she is the least-mutated mutant ever born.
And yet she's cursed to live the horrible degrading life of a mutant. Like all of us. Especially him!
xml.info: He points at the Leg Mutant.
xml.speak: It's true!
Maybe we can do better for her.
xml.info: Outside Cookieville Minimum-Secuirty Orphanarium. The mutants come out of a manhole near the building with their baby. They put it in a basket outside the front door. The father puts a bracelet on the baby's wrist.
xml.speak: I made this bracelet so that in some small way, we'll always be with you, even when it doesn't seem like it. During your entire life, for example.
xml.info: He kisses her.
xml.speak: You won't pass for human, cutie. But if my PhD in exo-liguistics is worth diddly-poop, this note should convince them you're an alien. And that'll be enough to give you a real life.
xml.info: She kisses the baby, puts her hood up and runs down the steps. The father rings the doorbell and follows her. Warden Vogel opens the door and sees the baby. The parent's watch from the manhole.
xml.speak: She'll never know we're her parents.
That's our gift to her. Better we should die than have her learn the shameful truth of her origin.
I'm with you.
xml.info: They hug. Then turn to watch Vogel.
xml.speak: What a beautiful gigantic eye you ha -- . Well come on in.
xml.info: The parents watch Leela disappear inside, hold their breath and dive into the sewers.
Flashback ends.
New New York Sewers. Leela is still chasing the hooded figures. They run into the building and lock the door. Leela climbs a pole and jumps onto the roof.
Cut to: Building.
xml.speak: Keep quiet so she doesn't hear us.
What's there to talk about?
Shhh!
xml.info: Leela stands behind them.
xml.speak: Hands up! Tentacles too!
xml.info: The other one puts her tentacles up.
xml.speak: Don't say anything stupid, Morris.
What is all this? Am I a game to you? Or some kind of even more boring Truman Show? Do you belive I'm you Messiah? Your Mutant Dali Lama? Stop me if I guess it!
Well actually there --
xml.info: Hooded Figure #1 stops him.
xml.speak: Morris! Shh!

(angry) And what about this?! How did you get this bracelet? Did you steal it from me when I was a baby? Or from my parents. You robbed my parents, didn't you? I bet you sick mutants killed them. My parents were confused aliens lost on Earth and you killed them! Is that it? Admit it!
(sombre) Yes. We killed them.
You guessed the truth.
xml.info: Leela screams.
xml.speak: Because of you I'll never know my parents. I'll kill you!
xml.info: She raises her gun.
xml.speak: That would be best.
xml.info: Time Lapse. Leela charges her laser. It bleeps. The hooded figures hold each other.
xml.speak: Stop! Thanks Bender! Don't do it Leela!
They killed my parents!
Close.
xml.info: He walks behind the hooded figures and pulls their hoods off. They are the mutants from the flashback. Leela lowers her gun.
xml.speak: They are my parents.
Yes.
I had the Professor analyse the alienese letter that was found with you.
What does it say?
I 'unno. But the analysis showed it was printed on recycled toilet paper. A squeezably soft paper used mainly in the sewers.
xml.info: Leela's mother takes the paper.
xml.speak: It says, "Your parents love you very much".
We still do.
So, I'm not an alien? I'm a mutant.
We never wanted you to know. You deserved a better life.
You must despise us.
(crying) You're my parents. All I've ever wanted is to know you. This is the happiest moment of my life.
xml.info: They cry. It starts to rain.
Cut to: New New York Street. It isn't raining - Bender is emptying a spitoon on them.
xml.speak: Aww!
xml.info: Flashbacks. Over the flashbacks Pizzicato Five's Baby Love Child plays. Baby Leela crawls down a corridor at the Orphanarium and nearly falls down the stairs. Her father's arm comes out of the wall and turns her around. Young Leela sits at a desk in her room studying. Her mother's tentacle comes through the toilet and puts a box of cookies on her desk. Leela smiles and eats them. Adolescent Leela walks around New New York on her birthday with no friends. Her mother puts a present on the pavement for her. She reads the message with it: Happy Birthday Leela. Mid-twenties Leela tosses and turns in bed. Her father puts his arm through the laundry chute and pulls the sheet over her. She smiles and goes to sleep.
THE END
